TransformedBitmap Class

Definition

Scales and rotates a BitmapSource.

In this Article

public sealed class TransformedBitmap : System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource, System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize

Remarks

TransformedBitmap supports only orthogonal transforms such as rotation transforms of 90Â° increments and scale transforms. Transforms that skew the image are not supported.

TransformedBitmap implements the ISupportInitialize interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties. Property changes can only occur during object initialization. Call BeginInit to signal that initialization has begun and EndInit to signal that initialization has completed. After initialization, property changes are ignored.

TransformedBitmap objects created using the TransformedBitmap(BitmapSource,Transform) constructor are automatically initialized and property changes are ignored.

Metadata tags related to image data must be updated if an image is saved to a file after a transform is applied.

Constructors

TransformedBitmap()

Initializes a new instance of the TransformedBitmap class.

public TransformedBitmap ();

Remarks

TransformedBitmap implements the ISupportInitialize interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties. To initialize a TransformedBitmap created using this constructor, you must perform property initialization between BeginInit and EndInit calls.

TransformedBitmap(BitmapSource,Transform)

Initializes a new instance of the TransformedBitmap class that has the specified stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.Source* and stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.Transform*.

public TransformedBitmap (System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource source, System.Windows.Media.Transform newTransform);

newTransform
Transform

The stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.Transform* of the new TransformedBitmap instance.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The source parameter is null.

InvalidOperationException

The newTransform parameter is null.

-or-

The transform is not an orthogonal transform.

Remarks

TransformedBitmap objects created using this constructor are automatically initialized. After initialization, property changes are ignored.

Fields

SourceProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.Source* dependency property.

public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty SourceProperty;

TransformProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.Transform* dependency property.

public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty TransformProperty;

Properties

Source

Gets or sets the source for the bitmap.

public System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource Source { get; set; }
Value
System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource

The source for the bitmap. The default value is null.

Remarks

You can chain a TransformedBitmap to another BitmapSource by setting the Source property of the TransformedBitmap to the BitmapSource that you want. See How to: Chain BitmapSource Objects Together for an example of chaining.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field SourceProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Transform

Gets or sets the Transform, which specifies the scale or rotation of the bitmap.

public System.Windows.Media.Transform Transform { get; set; }
Value
Transform

The Transform, which specifies the scale or rotation of the bitmap. The default value is stem.Windows.Media.Transform.Identity*.

Remarks

TransformedBitmap supports only orthogonal transforms such as rotation transforms of 90 increments and scale transforms. Transforms that skew the image are not supported.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field TransformProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Methods

BeginInit()

Signals the start of the TransformedBitmap initialization.

public void BeginInit ();
Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The TransformedBitmap is currently being initialized. BeginInit has already been called.

-or-

The TransformedBitmap has already been initialized.

Remarks

Property initialization must be done between BeginInit and EndInit calls. Once the TransformedBitmap has been initialized, property changes are ignored.

Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this TransformedBitmap, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

public System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap Clone ();
Returns
TransformedBitmap

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see Clone.
